Instructions: Change the input with the buttons in the top right.
The result is printed in the console.
Algorithm: Compute a generation per frame, expanding the size of the list as needed, keeping track of the offset with pot 0.
When the first to pots are empty, remove one and update the offset accordingly.
Because of this, for higher generation counts it's easy to notive the point where the pattern doesn't change, except an offset.
When this happens, compute the offset of the final and use it to get the total value of that generation.
Display: The offset for each generation is stored, so empty pots are added before and after what is stored so that everything is aligned properly.
